page.title: 10A FARMER'S WIFE NEAR SEISDON
page.content:
A farmer' wife, whose husband and son work the family farm near Abbot's Castle Hill described her life. She has always worked hard, looking after the house and garden and helping with the farm, especially the poultry and, until recently, the dairy herd. Now they keep only one cow for milk. The farm consists mainly of arable land which yields good crops. She loves farming and country life and is obviously contented with her lot. She ackowledges the difficulties
of shopping, getting to the doctor, etc. and has to rely on her husband or son to take her as she no longer drives a car. For this reason too she has had to stop attending Women's Institute meetings in nearby Trysull. However, she enjoys handicrafts and spends her evenings knitting,
